intro: Straussia sessilis, commonly known as the sessile straussia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
